ref: 8864 prastārá m. ʻ spreading out ʼ MBh., ʻ bed of straw, (v.l. prastara -- ) plain ʼ Hariv., ʻ overgrown jungle ʼ lex. [√str̥]
Pk. patthāra -- m. ʻ expansion, bed of leaves ʼ, ˚rī -- f. ʻ bed ʼ;
N. pathārā ʻ sick bed, prostration through illness ʼ;
A. pathār ʻ level land cleared of trees, meadow ʼ, pathāli ʻ width ʼ, adj. ʻ extending crosswise ʼ;
B. pāthār ʻ large expanse of water ʼ;
Bi. khet -- pathār ʻ the whole cultivation of a proprietor ʼ, pathārī ʻ place where cowdung cakes are made ʼ, (Saran) ʻ cut crop left on field to dry ʼ;
Bhoj. pathār ʻ spreading out grain to dry ʼ;
G. parthār m. ʻ bed ʼ (or < *paristāra -- Add.?), pathār, ˚rɔ m. ʻ expanse ʼ, ˚rī f. ʻ bedding ʼ;
Si. patara ʻ anything that spreads itself (liquid, water, dust), assembly, mass ʼ, patura ʻ planed piece of wood ʼ (or < prastará -- ).
